datasets.name: Survey Data (Descriptive Statistics)
datasets.description: 30 participants with demographic and survey data. Includes age, height, weight, gender, education level, income, and satisfaction scores.

datasets.name: Test Scores (One-Sample T-Test)
datasets.description: 30 participants with test scores and health measurements. Use to test if population mean equals a hypothesized value (e.g., test_score mean = 80).

datasets.name: Treatment Groups (Independent T-Test)
datasets.description: 30 participants divided into two groups (treatment vs control). Compare performance metrics between groups.

datasets.name: Pre-Post Measurements (Paired T-Test)
datasets.description: 30 participants measured before and after an intervention. Compare pre-test vs post-test scores, weight loss, anxiety reduction.

datasets.name: Treatment Comparison (One-Way ANOVA)
datasets.description: 30 participants across 3 treatment groups (A, B, C). Compare scores, improvement, and satisfaction across groups. Group A shows highest performance.

datasets.name: Student Performance (Correlation)
datasets.description: 30 students with study habits and academic outcomes. Explore relationships between study hours, sleep, exam scores, stress, motivation, and attendance.

datasets.name: Personality Survey (Factor Analysis)
datasets.description: 50 participants responded to 12 survey items. Items 1-6 and 10 load on Factor 1 (Extraversion), items 7-9 and 11-12 load on Factor 2 (Conscientiousness).

datasets.name: Salary Prediction (Linear Regression)
datasets.description: 30 employees with salary and predictor variables. Predict salary from experience, education, performance, and age. Strong predictors: experience, education.

datasets.name: Work Stress Mediation (PROCESS Model 4)
datasets.description: 50 employees with work stress, job satisfaction, and turnover intention. Tests whether job satisfaction mediates the relationship between work stress and turnover intention.

datasets.name: Training Effectiveness (PROCESS Model 1)
datasets.description: 50 employees with training hours, performance scores, and prior experience. Tests whether prior experience moderates the relationship between training and performance.

expectedResults.interaction: negative (training effect weaker for experienced workers)
expectedResults.simpleSlopes: significant at low and mean experience

datasets.name: Personality Scale (Confirmatory Factor Analysis)
datasets.description: 60 participants responded to 12 personality items measuring 3 latent factors: Extraversion (ext1-4), Conscientiousness (con1-4), and Neuroticism (neu1-4).

datasets.name: Academic Achievement (Path Analysis)
datasets.description: 50 students with SES, parental involvement, academic motivation, study habits, and achievement. Tests a path model: SES → parental involvement → motivation → study habits → achievement.

expectedResults.indirectEffects: SES has significant indirect effect on achievement

datasets.name: Stress-Depression Study (PROCESS Model 7)
datasets.description: 100 participants with stress, social support (moderator), coping (mediator), and depression (outcome). Tests whether social support moderates the X→M path in the mediation model.

datasets.name: Work-Family Study (Serial Mediation)
datasets.description: 100 employees with workload (X), work stress (M1), burnout (M2), and life satisfaction (Y). Tests sequential mediation: workload → stress → burnout → life satisfaction.

expectedResults.serialIndirectEffect: negative (high workload → high stress → burnout → low satisfaction)

datasets.name: Cross-Cultural Scale Validation (Multigroup CFA)
datasets.description: 300 participants across 3 cultural groups testing measurement invariance of a 12-item scale with 3 factors.

datasets.name: Organizational Behavior (Full SEM)
datasets.description: 250 employees with latent variables for Leadership (4 items), Engagement (4 items), Performance (4 items), and Satisfaction (4 items). Tests structural model with measurement.

datasets.name: School Achievement (Multilevel/HLM)
datasets.description: 500 students nested within 25 schools. Level-1: student SES and math achievement. Level-2: school type and mean SES. Tests cross-level interactions.

expectedResults.crossLevelInteraction: school SES moderates student SES effect

datasets.name: Leadership & Performance (PROCESS Model 8)
datasets.description: 80 teams with leadership style (X), team cohesion (M), job performance (Y), and organizational culture (W). Model 8: W moderates both X→M and X→Y paths.

expectedResults.conditionalEffects: significant at different levels of culture

datasets.name: Advertising & Purchase (PROCESS Model 58)
datasets.description: 80 consumers with advertising spend (X), brand awareness (M), purchase intention (Y), and product quality (W). Model 58: W moderates both X→M and M→Y paths.

datasets.name: Leadership & Commitment (PROCESS Model 59)
datasets.description: 80 employees with transformational leadership (X), employee engagement (M), organizational commitment (Y), and trust climate (W). Model 59: W moderates all paths (a, b, c').

expectedResults.moderatedPaths: W moderates all paths (a, b, c')
expectedResults.conditionalEffects: all effects strengthened by high trust climate
